channel.title: Own File Extension
channel.description: how do you make your own file extensions such as items.watever?

item.title: Own File Extension
item.dc:creator: @i_dont_care i dont care
item.description:
@i_dont_care wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch™, post:4, topic:152727”]Also, i find this way easier to do. Go to control panel, and uncheck the box to hide common extensions of file. So you would see file as:

Moparscape.exe Instead of Moparscape. And if you right click it, you can change the extension yourself, and it prompts you if you want to do it.

BTW good for hiding porn… .mpg to .txt =S.[/quote]

lol

Read full topic

item.title: Own File Extension
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch™, post:17, topic:152727”][quote author=ectophantom link=topic=208931.msg1832110#msg1832110 date=1192854124]
None of that is what you do >.<

  1. Open up My Documents
  2. Click tools at the top, then folder options
  3. Click file types, and wait for the list to load
  4. Click new
  5. Type in the file extension you want <ex.> anythingscape
  6. Click advanced
  7. Changed the associated file type to the type of file it is going to be <ex.> If you wanted it to be a .java file, just with a different extension, you would associate it with .java
  8. Click OK

Extra; To change the icon

  1. make an icon or get an icon from the web or something.
  2. To make an icon, open up paint and paint your icon.
  3. Press File, Save As, and when you type in the name, you have to type it as “name”.ico (without the quotes)
  4. To set it to the icon, go back to the file types and highlight your file type.
  5. Click advanced near the bottom on the right.
  6. Click change icon.
  7. Click Browse.
  8. Browse, find your icon, and double click it.
  9. Press OK

[/quote]

Totally owned me.[/quote] i second vote what you just said =P lol. and i dont think this topic belongs here… belongs here:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/

Read full topic

  7. Changed the associated file type to the type of file it is going to be <ex.> If you wanted it to be a .java file, just with a different extension, you would associate it with .java
  8. Click OK

Extra; To change the icon

  1. make an icon or get an icon from the web or something.

  5. Click advanced near the bottom on the right.
  6. Click change icon.
  7. Click Browse.
  8. Browse, find your icon, and double click it.
  9. Press OK[/quote]i luve what you wrote. it helps =P thanks. but… when other peoples download it. it w0nt come up the same… but g00d
    [hr]
    EDIT:

you can just use notepad and save it as an extension and when your comp doesn’t recognize, the pop will ask which to open with =P and thats faster =p

Read full topic

item.title: Own File Extension

@ectophantom wrote:

None of that is what you do >.<

  1. Open up My Documents
  2. Click tools at the top, then folder options
  3. Click file types, and wait for the list to load
  4. Click new
  5. Type in the file extension you want <ex.> anythingscape
  6. Click advanced
  7. Changed the associated file type to the type of file it is going to be <ex.> If you wanted it to be a .java file, just with a different extension, you would associate it with .java
  8. Click OK

Extra; To change the icon

  1. make an icon or get an icon from the web or something.
  2. To make an icon, open up paint and paint your icon.
  3. Press File, Save As, and when you type in the name, you have to type it as “name”.ico (without the quotes)
  4. To set it to the icon, go back to the file types and highlight your file type.
  5. Click advanced near the bottom on the right.
  6. Click change icon.
  7. Click Browse.
  8. Browse, find your icon, and double click it.
